channel.title: BetterDev Feed
channel.description: RSS Feed To Fetch BetterDev Feed

item.title: Using AWK and R to parse 25tb
item.description: Knowing tools like awk, sed helps immensively when need to process text based log file fast. AWK in itself is a whole programing language. Lets follow this journy of bringing the query time and cost down from 8 minutes and $20 to a tenth of a second and less than a penny,

item.title: How Discord Stores Billions of Messages — Big Surprises in System Design
item.description: The biggest supprise is they don’t use cache.

item.title: What is in that .git directory?
item.description: Well, I think most of you reading this blog use git more or less on a daily basis, but have you ever looked into what is in the .git folder that git creates? Let’s explore it together and understand what is going on in there.

item.title: An Interactive Intro to CRDTs
item.description: Have you heard about CRDTs and wondered what they are? Maybe you’ve looked into them a bit, but ran into a wall of academic papers and math jargon?

item.title: Profiling Python and Ruby using eBPF
item.description: Dive into the internals of profiling interpreted Python and Ruby code using eBPF

item.title: BPFAgent: eBPF for Monitoring at DoorDash
item.description: Metrics, logs, and traces provide vital information. But these signals almost entirely rely on application-level instrumentation, which can leave gaps or conflicting semantics across different systems. DoorDash decided to seek potential solutions that could provide a more complete and unified picture of their networking topology

item.title: Scaling GraphQL with Postgres - Lessons learned from our database timeout issues
item.description: Cycle app has a lot of issue about time out db connection. They workaround by run health check more often to auto restart. Wh

item.title: Five Great Features of the PostgreSQL Partition Manager
item.description: pg_partman is a tool to partition your table into either time based or number based. In this article they discussed 5 important features to help managing large tables in PostgresSQL.

item.title: Fine-Tuning Mistral7B on Python Code With A Single GPU!
Flui Simulation
item.description: A step by step notion note of Kynd, explain how to design and implement a fluid simulation. Very detail at every step, together with codepen to run and follow. You will learn a lot follow this

item.title: Speeding up the JavaScript ecosystem - The barrel file debacle
item.description: Part 7 of this series about JS performance. In this, Marvinhh discussed why the import-re-export in a index.js, while convenience for consumer cause perfomrnace degrade.

item.title: mods
item.description: LLM based AI is really good at interpreting the output of commands and returning the results in CLI friendly text formats like Markdown.

item.title: Viselect
item.description: A high performance and lightweight library to add a visual way of selecting elements, just like on your Desktop. Zero dependencies, super small. Support for major frameworks!

item.title: faststream
item.description: simplifies the process of writing producers and consumers for message queues, handling all the parsing, networking and documentation generation automatically.

item.title: httpx
item.description: An HTTP client library for ruby that support HTTP/2

item.title: nokolexbor
item.description: Nokolexbor is a drop-in replacement for Nokogiri. It’s 5.2x faster at parsing HTML and up to 997x faster at CSS selectors. Another similar one is Oga but it has been lack of active development

item.title: evidence
item.description: an open source, code-based alternative to drag-and-drop business intelligence tools. You can write markdown, and generate embed chart(through query your warehouse), like traditional BI tools but now can also embed them into markdown.

item.title: payloadcms
item.description: The best way to build a modern backend + admin UI. No black magic, all TypeScript, and fully open-source, Payload is both an app framework and a headless CMS.

item.title: pgmetrics
item.description: Collect and display information and stats from a running PostgreSQL server. A must say to have, very easy to install with a single binary. A similar tools but tailor toward Ruby/Rails is PgHero
